summary: The Prairie Spirit Trail ultramarathon is a premier 'rails-to-trails' event in eastern Kansas that challenges runners with a fast, flat, and scenic out-and-back course between Ottawa and Iola. Favored by both first-timers and elite athletes for its 100-mile, 100K, 50-mile, and 50K distances, the race offers a rhythmic journey through tranquil rural landscapes and charming historic town centers.
uniqueFeatures: Ultra-Fast Rail Trail: The course is exceptionally flat with minimal elevation change, following a former railroad bed composed of smooth, crushed limestone that is ideal for setting personal records.

Custom Finisher Buckles for All Distances: Distinguishing itself from many other ultras, this race awards unique, custom-designed finisher buckles to all participants who complete an ultra-distance event, including the 50K and 50-mile races.

Depot-to-Depot Aid Stations: Many aid stations are situated at historic train depots in small Kansas towns, providing a nostalgic atmosphere and excellent accessibility for support crews and family members.

media.contentSummary: This article profiles the success of Great Plains runners in the early stages of the Trail Runner Trophy Series, featuring an interview with age-group leader Allyson Weimer and a detailed leaderboard across various divisions.

media.title: State Records & Stroller Runs: Angela Smith’s Record-Breaking Run at the Prairie Spirit 100
media.summary: An in-depth interview with the Kansas state record holder that provides strategic insights into fueling, mindset, and navigating the flat, exposed sections of the Prairie Spirit course.
media.contentSummary: Angela Smith discusses setting the Kansas state record at the Prairie Spirit 100-miler in under 16 hours, covering her training, fueling strategies, and balancing ultrarunning with family life.

media.title: The Beast of Kansas: Kayla Straub on Resilience and the Prairie Spirit 100
media.summary: A profile of the elite runner’s journey to a course record, offering advice on managing physical grit and the psychological demands of the Kansas prairie trails.
media.contentSummary: Host David Theriot interviews Kayla Straub about her rapid success in ultrarunning, her record-setting performance at the Prairie Spirit 100, and balancing farm life with endurance sports.
